dict.string: Inbound / Outbound Nondelivery (2#)
#OBSpid

GENERAL EXPLANATION OF WHY SPID ISSUE OCCURRED:


Hello _______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support!


To provide some background information, the SMS registrar makes updates to numbers used for SMS messaging to ensure these numbers are routing properly. However, when the SMS registrar makes these changes they do not always notify SMS providers, such as Twilio. Unfortunately, currently, Twilio does not get notified when the registrar make updates to our numbers and hence, Twilio also is unable to notify our customers. We are in continuous conversation with the registrar to improve and change how they accept and update registrations. We hope that the registrar can notify providers such as Twilio and provide this visibility soon.


Again, we sincerely apologize for the trouble this issue has caused. Please let me know if you have any further questions.


Thanks,


————


SPID ISSUE AFTER NUMBER IS PORTED IN:



Hello _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support!


When numbers are ported into Twilio, there's a unique ID that indicates that these numbers are now part of Twilio's network. However, sometimes ported numbers do not reflect this new unique ID and may still reflect the previous unique ID from the old provider. When this happens, I need to work with our carrier to make sure these numbers are successfully updated to Twilio's unique ID.


May I ask do you have any other ported numbers? I will like to make sure all of these numbers are updated successfully.


I look forward to hearing back from you.


Thanks,
Outbound SMS - Non-Delivery Due to SPID Issues

GENERAL EXPLANATION OF WHY SPID ISSUE OCCURRED:
Hello _______,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support!
To provide some background information, the SMS registrar makes updates to numbers used for SMS messaging to ensure these numbers are routing properly. However, when the SMS registrar makes these changes they do not always notify SMS providers, such as Twilio. Unfortunately, currently, Twilio does not get notified when the registrar make updates to our numbers and hence, Twilio also is unable to notify our customers. We are in continuous conversation with the registrar to improve and change how they accept and update registrations. We hope that the registrar can notify providers such as Twilio and provide this visibility soon.
Again, we sincerely apologize for the trouble this issue has caused. Please let me know if you have any further questions.
Thanks,
————
SPID ISSUE AFTER NUMBER IS PORTED IN:
Hello _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support!
When numbers are ported into Twilio, there's a unique ID that indicates that these numbers are now part of Twilio's network. However, sometimes ported numbers do not reflect this new unique ID and may still reflect the previous unique ID from the old provider. When this happens, I need to work with our carrier to make sure these numbers are successfully updated to Twilio's unique ID.
May I ask do you have any other ported numbers? I will like to make sure all of these numbers are updated successfully.
I look forward to hearing back from you.
Thanks,
#OBVerifySMS

Dear ______,


Thank you very much for contacting Twilio Support.


I am sorry to hear that your SMS message was not delivered. May you please verify the number that you tried to send this SMS message to? The reason I ask is because there is a limitation for Twilio trial accounts where you will need to verify a mobile phone number before you can send SMS messages to it from your Twilio trial phone number. According to our records, you only have ______ verified to receive SMS messages.


Please visit the link below to verify numbers to send SMS messages to from your Twilio number:


https://www.twilio.com/user/account/phone-numbers/verified


If you do not want to verify each and every number that you would like to send SMS messages to, please feel free to upgrade your Twilio account.


I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Outbound SMS - Trial Limitations - Verify SMS Caller ID for Trial Accounts

Dear ______,
Thank you very much for contacting Twilio Support.
I am sorry to hear that your SMS message was not delivered. May you please verify the number that you tried to send this SMS message to? The reason I ask is because there is a limitation for Twilio trial accounts where you will need to verify a mobile phone number before you can send SMS messages to it from your Twilio trial phone number. According to our records, you only have ______ verified to receive SMS messages.
Please visit the link below to verify numbers to send SMS messages to from your Twilio number:
https://www.twilio.com/user/account/phone-numbers/verified
If you do not want to verify each and every number that you would like to send SMS messages to, please feel free to upgrade your Twilio account.
I hope this information is helpful. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
#OBSingle

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that _____ did not receive your SMS message.


May I ask are other _____ numbers unable to receive messages? Our carrier has confirmed that messages were successfully delivered to _____ and they are not experiencing issues delivering messages to ____. We have not received reports from other customers having issues delivering to _____.


As this is a single number issue, we kindly ask you to please check the below points with end user. I will recommend that the end user to please kindly retest in restarting their phone. If issue still persist after restarting their phone, please take a look at the additional suggestions below:



1.) Handset inbox memory is free.


2.) Handset is in good Network coverage area. Did your end user have good network coverage at the time your sent the message? Was the phone off?


3.) Retest message delivery to this destination whilst eliminating any potential handset related issues. Power cycle the device to re-establish communication OR Insert the SIM in different handset and then perform a fresh test to isolate any handset related issue


4.) End user is not in roaming/ or traveling out of country.


5.) Our carrier requests for 3 or more examples from the past 48 hours from unique recipients, if your end user consistently does not receive messages. Please provide additional examples from unique recipients so that we can pass these examples along to our carrier for further investigation.


6.) Please make sure end user isn't using a pre-paid plan and that they had sufficient funds in their account during the time you attempted to send messages to the end user.


7.) Check with their mobile provider for further insight.


If there is any issue that still persists, please do let us know. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Outbound SMS - Single Number User Issue

Dear ____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that _____ did not receive your SMS message.
May I ask are other _____ numbers unable to receive messages? Our carrier has confirmed that messages were successfully delivered to _____ and they are not experiencing issues delivering messages to ____. We have not received reports from other customers having issues delivering to _____.
As this is a single number issue, we kindly ask you to please check the below points with end user. I will recommend that the end user to please kindly retest in restarting their phone. If issue still persist after restarting their phone, please take a look at the additional suggestions below:
1.) Handset inbox memory is free.
2.) Handset is in good Network coverage area. Did your end user have good network coverage at the time your sent the message? Was the phone off?
3.) Retest message delivery to this destination whilst eliminating any potential handset related issues. Power cycle the device to re-establish communication OR Insert the SIM in different handset and then perform a fresh test to isolate any handset related issue
4.) End user is not in roaming/ or traveling out of country.
5.) Our carrier requests for 3 or more examples from the past 48 hours from unique recipients, if your end user consistently does not receive messages. Please provide additional examples from unique recipients so that we can pass these examples along to our carrier for further investigation.
6.) Please make sure end user isn't using a pre-paid plan and that they had sufficient funds in their account during the time you attempted to send messages to the end user.
7.) Check with their mobile provider for further insight.
If there is any issue that still persists, please do let us know. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
#OBMMSMedia

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are experiencing an issue with ______.


To set some expectations, please be aware that Twilio fully supports content-types of image/jpeg, image/gif, and image/png only. Any other content-types received or sent outside of these supported content-types such as _____ cannot be guaranteed for acceptance or delivery. Twilio will not reject it but the content will also not be modified for device compatibility. What this means is that it depends on destination carrier and also the handsets sending and receiving the messages.  I will recommend doing some testing on various phones to ensure _____ are supported on different handsets and destination carriers as Twilio will not guarantee acceptance on all handsets and carriers.

I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.

Warmest Regards,
Outbound MMS - Accepted Vs Supported Media Types jpeg, img, png

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are experiencing an issue with ______.
To set some expectations, please be aware that Twilio fully supports content-types of image/jpeg, image/gif, and image/png only. Any other content-types received or sent outside of these supported content-types such as _____ cannot be guaranteed for acceptance or delivery. Twilio will not reject it but the content will also not be modified for device compatibility. What this means is that it depends on destination carrier and also the handsets sending and receiving the messages. I will recommend doing some testing on various phones to ensure _____ are supported on different handsets and destination carriers as Twilio will not guarantee acceptance on all handsets and carriers.
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
#IBMMSInt

Hello ____,


Since Twilio international numbers do not support MMS messages, these numbers are unable to receive MMS inbound. As a result, if your users sends a MMS to your Twilio number, the MMS will not be received at all. We are unable to convert the MMS message into a URL for **inbound** messages. However, if you are sending an **outbound** MMS message, Twilio is able to convert the image into a URL link in which your users can press.


I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. We understand that this is a limitation and we continue to work hard in hopes that we can support MMS messaging for international numbers in the near future.


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Inbound/ Outbound MMS - No MMS Support for International Numbers

Hello ____,
Since Twilio international numbers do not support MMS messages, these numbers are unable to receive MMS inbound. As a result, if your users sends a MMS to your Twilio number, the MMS will not be received at all. We are unable to convert the MMS message into a URL for **inbound** messages. However, if you are sending an **outbound** MMS message, Twilio is able to convert the image into a URL link in which your users can press.
I sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. We understand that this is a limitation and we continue to work hard in hopes that we can support MMS messaging for international numbers in the near future.
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
C4C74D6D-4FCB-41BF-A2B1-DACE79899979
#OBLandline

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that when delivering SMS messages to landline numbers, the messages are displayed as "delivered".


The reason that you are seeing messages as "delivered" is because Twilio will not check whether the number is a landline for US, Canada, and United Kingdom numbers and will send it to our carrier for delivery. We do not check because some carriers will convert the SMS into text-to-speech messages via voice calls. Twilio is unable to detect which carriers will convert SMS messages to voice calls and which will not, hence we will send the the messages out for delivery. For more information about SMS guidelines by country please refer below:


https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/us


A workaround to this is to implement the Lookups API into your system which will check whether the number is a landline or a mobile number and your system can decide whether to attempt in sending the messages when Lookups API detects it's a landline number. Please see below as well for more information:


https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/lookups


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Outbound SMS - Sending SMS to Landline Numbers (US, UK, and Canada)

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that when delivering SMS messages to landline numbers, the messages are displayed as "delivered".
The reason that you are seeing messages as "delivered" is because Twilio will not check whether the number is a landline for US, Canada, and United Kingdom numbers and will send it to our carrier for delivery. We do not check because some carriers will convert the SMS into text-to-speech messages via voice calls. Twilio is unable to detect which carriers will convert SMS messages to voice calls and which will not, hence we will send the the messages out for delivery. For more information about SMS guidelines by country please refer below:
https://www.twilio.com/sms/guidelines/us
A workaround to this is to implement the Lookups API into your system which will check whether the number is a landline or a mobile number and your system can decide whether to attempt in sending the messages when Lookups API detects it's a landline number. Please see below as well for more information:
https://www.twilio.com/docs/api/lookups
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
#OB72Hours

To provide some background information, our carrier (as well as most destination carriers) have a 72 hours validity period/waiting period. What happens is that Twilio will send your messages out to our carrier for delivery. Our carrier will then send the messages out to the destination carrier for delivery. It appears that for your examples, when the destination carrier (for example, Sprint) received the messages from our carrier, the destination carrier never passed back a final delivery confirmation of "delivered" or "undelivered" back to our carrier, hence Twilio also never updated the final delivery status for your messages. Our carrier will then wait up to 72 hours for final delivery status from the destination carrier. If the destination carrier returns a final delivery status back to our carrier within 72 hours, our carrier will pass this updated information to Twilio. If our carrier doesn't receive delivery status within 72 hours, the message will fail on our carrier's platform and our carrier will then mark it as undelivered and send that information over to us as well. All in all, status changes will happen within and up to a 72 hour period. 

The reason for this "waiting period" is normally an issue with the customer's handset. Destination carriers are attempting to retry with 72 hour window and is hoping to be able to deliver the message to the customer within 72 hours. Reasons such as: customer is roaming out of country, customer handset was turned off, poor reception/network connectivity, unpaid bill, and other handset related issues. I will advise to monitor to see if most of your messages that remained in "sent" state is within this 72 hour window as our carrier may be waiting for final delivery status from destination carrier.
Outbound SMS - 72 Hours Validity Period General Information

To provide some background information, our carrier (as well as most destination carriers) have a 72 hours validity period/waiting period. What happens is that Twilio will send your messages out to our carrier for delivery. Our carrier will then send the messages out to the destination carrier for delivery. It appears that for your examples, when the destination carrier (for example, Sprint) received the messages from our carrier, the destination carrier never passed back a final delivery confirmation of "delivered" or "undelivered" back to our carrier, hence Twilio also never updated the final delivery status for your messages. Our carrier will then wait up to 72 hours for final delivery status from the destination carrier. If the destination carrier returns a final delivery status back to our carrier within 72 hours, our carrier will pass this updated information to Twilio. If our carrier doesn't receive delivery status within 72 hours, the message will fail on our carrier's platform and our carrier will then mark it as undelivered and send that information over to us as well. All in all, status changes will happen within and up to a 72 hour period.
The reason for this "waiting period" is normally an issue with the customer's handset. Destination carriers are attempting to retry with 72 hour window and is hoping to be able to deliver the message to the customer within 72 hours. Reasons such as: customer is roaming out of country, customer handset was turned off, poor reception/network connectivity, unpaid bill, and other handset related issues. I will advise to monitor to see if most of your messages that remained in "sent" state is within this 72 hour window as our carrier may be waiting for final delivery status from destination carrier.
#OBNoLC

OPTION 1:



Hello ______,


We currently do not support SMS-enabled numbers in ______. However, we have numbers in US, Canada, and other countries that supports international/global SMS messages. Let say you purchased a US number, this number will allow you to send and receive SMS messages in South Africa but will show up with a US country code.


For more information in regards to what numbers are international/global SMS-enabled please refer to the link below and scroll down to the "SMS Enabled Phone Numbers" section:


https://www.twilio.com/help/faq/phone-numbers/which-countries-does-twilio-have-phone-numbers-in-and-what-are-their-capabilities


Please feel free to let me know if you have further questions.


Thank you,

——


OPTION 2:


Dear Larry,


Thank you for your e-mail and your interest in SMS-enabled numbers in _____. We currently do not support SMS-enabled numbers in _____. In the meantime, as a workaround, you can use our supported International US SMS-enabled numbers that will be able to send SMS messages to this country.


Twilio is actively working on providing phone numbers in more countries as quickly as we can. I will recommend signing up with our Phone Numbers Beta Program where you will be contacted through e-mail when we add numbers in new countries. I have attached the link below. Additionally, feel free to check in with our availability's page that I also provided below for updates.


https://www.twilio.com/international/beta


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223183068-Twilio-international-phone-number-availability-and-their-capabilities


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or answer for you. I am more than happy to help out!


Warmest Regards,


Josephine T.
Outbound SMS - Do not Support Long Codes in Requested Country

#OBEmoji

Dear _____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that emoji sent showed up as encoded characters.


Emoji support has not been standardized across carriers, as a result we cannot guarantee support for Emoji across all carriers. Twilio will do the best we can to ensure the Emoji in your message is delivered to your mobile carrier.


If sending emojis will be integral to your business, you will need to perform carrier and device testing, as emojis are not supported by Twilio and we cannot guarantee their delivery and appearance. Please keep in mind that different carriers such as iPhone, Android, and Windows phone may support different brands of emojis. Please test accordingly.


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Outbound SMS - Do Not Support Emojis

Dear _____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear that emoji sent showed up as encoded characters.
Emoji support has not been standardized across carriers, as a result we cannot guarantee support for Emoji across all carriers. Twilio will do the best we can to ensure the Emoji in your message is delivered to your mobile carrier.
If sending emojis will be integral to your business, you will need to perform carrier and device testing, as emojis are not supported by Twilio and we cannot guarantee their delivery and appearance. Please keep in mind that different carriers such as iPhone, Android, and Windows phone may support different brands of emojis. Please test accordingly.
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
#inbounddeliver

OPTION 1:


Dear ______,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to receive messages from _____ to your Twilio number _____. 


To give you some background information, as the receiving end of SMS messages, Twilio cannot guarantee that every international SMS message sent to us will be received in your SMS Log. Twilio accepts these messages, however it is the responsibility of the sending phone number carrier to deliver the SMS message to our network.

While we do our best to accept these international messages, we have found that the international carriers are not always able to send SMS messages to our carrier. In this case, you will want to contact the carrier of the sending phone number to figure out why these messages were not delivered.

If the originating carrier could confirm that they handed the message off their network, I can check with our carrier partner to verify if the traffic hit their platform. Please check with originating carrier first to confirm delivery into Twilio's platform. If they confirm successful delivery, I can investigate further with our carrier to see why the messages were not passed into Twilio's platform. 


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help. 



Warmest Regards,


———


OPTION 2:


Hello _____,


To give you some background information, as the receiving end of SMS messages, Twilio cannot guarantee that every international SMS message sent to us will be received in your SMS Log. Twilio accepts these messages, however it is the responsibility of the sending phone number carrier to deliver the SMS message to our network.

While we do our best to accept these international messages, we have found that the international carriers are not always able to send SMS messages to our carrier. In this case, you will want to contact the carrier of the sending phone number to figure out why these messages were not delivered. Please let me know if the originating carrier confirmed that they handed the message off their network and into Twilio's network, I will need to gather additional information from you and reach out to our carrier for further investigation. 

Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,



———


OPTION 3:


Dear _____,



Thank you for contacting Twilio Support! I am very sorry to hear you are unable to receive inbound messages.


To give you some background information, as the receiving end of SMS messages, Twilio cannot guarantee that every international SMS message sent to us will be received in your SMS Log. Twilio accepts these messages, however it is the responsibility of the sending phone number carrier to deliver the SMS message to our network.


While we do our best to accept these international messages, we have found that the international carriers are not always able to send SMS messages to our carrier. In this case, you will want to contact the carrier of the sending phone number to figure out why these messages were not delivered.


If the originating carrier could confirm that they handed the message off their network, I can check with our carrier partner to verify if the traffic hit their platform. To do so, please kindly provide inbound non-delivery examples with the following information (I will recommend to conduct testing for at least 3 messages from the past 48 hours as our carrier requires at least 3 message examples to further investigate):


+ From Number

+ To Number

+ Message body

+ Date, time, and timezone of the message sent

+ Provide a screen shot of the inbound message if possible


Please let me know if you have any further questions. Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Outbound SMS - Inbound Non-Delivery for International SMS

#OBRejectedError

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to deliver messages to ______.


I further investigated into this message and it appears that we received a "Rejected Network" error from this number. This number may have been switched off, cannot be reached, or deactivated. May you please check to see if this number is still active?


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Outbound SMS - Non-Delivery Rejected Network/ Absent Subscriber Error

Dear ____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am very sorry to hear you are unable to deliver messages to ______.
I further investigated into this message and it appears that we received a "Rejected Network" error from this number. This number may have been switched off, cannot be reached, or deactivated. May you please check to see if this number is still active?
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
#OBMMSURLMismatch

Dear ____,


Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear you are experiencing issues using your Media URL.


After further investigation, it appears that the Media URL is an _____ file. Twilio is not accepting this because the actual image data and the extension do not match. Additionally, please note that Twilio fully supports png, jpeg,and gif files only. Please make sure the actual image data and the extension matches the above supported image types.


EXAMPLE REMOVE CUSTOMER’S URL TO QUERY:


curl https://www.digitalcustomernotification.com/system/proxy/e1492273800/l1489406034/di/c0/qy9TEcpkX8cTbruUy698H1-XxqFKOdCcoiWDcerBA6A/1/82/employee/91/91_large.jpg | file -


/dev/stdin: HTML document text


Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.


Warmest Regards,
Outbound MMS - Content-Type Does not Match Media URL

Dear ____,
Thank you for contacting Twilio Support. I am sorry to hear you are experiencing issues using your Media URL.
After further investigation, it appears that the Media URL is an _____ file. Twilio is not accepting this because the actual image data and the extension do not match. Additionally, please note that Twilio fully supports png, jpeg,and gif files only. Please make sure the actual image data and the extension matches the above supported image types.
EXAMPLE REMOVE CUSTOMER’S URL TO QUERY:
curl https://www.digitalcustomernotification.com/system/proxy/e1492273800/l1489406034/di/c0/qy9TEcpkX8cTbruUy698H1-XxqFKOdCcoiWDcerBA6A/1/82/employee/91/91_large.jpg | file -
/dev/stdin: HTML document text
Please let me know if there is anything else I can help you with or further clarify. More than happy to help.
Warmest Regards,
@OBMMSSize

Hello _____,


Please ensure that your image size is not larger than 500 KB. Twilio will help with resizing your images to the necessary size for delivery based on carrier specifications. An API request with an image larger than 500 KB will fail with an error.


https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223133547-Will-Twilio-automatically-resize-my-images-for-MMS-messaging-


Please let me know if you have further questions.


Thanks,
Outbound MMS - Image Sizes does not Exceed 500 KB/ 5 MB

Hello _____,
Please ensure that your image size is not larger than 500 KB. Twilio will help with resizing your images to the necessary size for delivery based on carrier specifications. An API request with an image larger than 500 KB will fail with an error.
https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/articles/223133547-Will-Twilio-automatically-resize-my-images-for-MMS-messaging-
Please let me know if you have further questions.
Thanks,
